alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 8:51AM PDT until June 08 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .High mountain snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM PDT Tuesday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 9.4 feet this evening. It will then rise above flood stage late this evening to 10.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage again tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/05/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Merced River Pohono Bridge 10.0 10.6 Tue 8 am PDT 9.7 9.4 9.5 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
